segments.text: It's striking to see the calm garden just outside the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Through the panes, I can see a neat path and some well-kept bushes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Everything out there looks so tranquil, so perfectly in order.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a stark contrast to the absolute mess brewing inside this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, spilling water everywhere like a mini-waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the children are making their own brand of chaos with those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost as if two different worlds are existing side-by-side.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it quite distressing, this disconnect between the inside and out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The peacefulness of the garden makes the indoor negligence stand out even more.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would just turn around and see the impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The bright daylight from the window highlights all the hazards so clearly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me wonder how things got so out of hand in the first place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The beautiful day outside deserves a more peaceful interior, doesn't it?
segments.speaker: PAR
